meanings.definition: Intromitters: those who introduce or insert something
meanings.sent1: The intromitters at the party welcomed everyone with smiles and handshakes.
meanings.sent2: The intromitters in the group project were responsible for presenting our ideas to the class.
meanings.sent3: The intromitters at the magic show amazed the audience by pulling rabbits out of hats.
meanings.sent4: The intromitters of new technology into our daily lives are like modern-day magicians.
meanings.sent5: The intromitters of change often face resistance from those comfortable with the status quo.

meanings.definition: Intromitters: devices or mechanisms used to introduce or insert something
meanings.sent1: The intromitters in the lab were essential for conducting experiments accurately.
meanings.sent2: The intromitters in the car engine regulate the flow of fuel for optimal performance.
meanings.sent3: The intromitters in the vending machine dispensed snacks with precision.
meanings.sent4: The intromitters of data into the system ensure smooth operations.
meanings.sent5: The intromitters of nutrients into the soil promote plant growth in the garden.
